title.narrative: Strengthening sustainability of NPAS in Jamaica

description.narrative: Strengthening the operational and financial sustainability of the National Protected Area System

title.narrative: Strengthening the Operational and Financial Sustainability of the NPAS

description.narrative: Strengthening the operational and financial sustainability of the national Protected Area System
independent political entity
Environment - policy, planning and administration
To consolidate the operational and financial sustainability of Jamaicaâ€˜s National System of Protected Areas
Increase in NSPA operational sustainability measured by average METT score for all PAs based on the following definitions: High (75-100), Medium (55-74), Low (<55).

comment.narrative: High: number of PAs - 0 Medium: number of PAs - 4 Low: number of PAs - 28
High: number of PAs - 2 Medium: number of PAs - 6 Low: number of PAs - 24
High: number of PAs - 1 Medium: number of PAs - 13 Low: number of PAs - 18

description.narrative: Increase in NSPA financial capacity measured by Financial Sustainability Scorecard

comment.narrative: Financial Score (Part 2): 53
Financial Score (Part 2): 122 (The highest score possible is 225)
The revised target includes that the highest score possible is 225. The Financial Sustainability scorecard will be applied to the project's mid term evaluation.

description.narrative: Area of Closed Broad-leaf Forest within NPAS sustained

comment.narrative: Broad-leaf: 88,000 hectares
No change in area of Closed Broad-leaf Forest: 88,000 hectares
The most current data is unavailable, however there is data for the 2012-2013 period which reflects a decrease of approximately 4,000 hectares.

description.narrative: Area of living reef within 10 NPAS monitoring sites sustained

comment.narrative: Area of Reef: 3% - 30% living
No change in Area of Reef: 3% - 30% living
The most current data is unavailable, however there is data for the 2012-2013 period which reflects no change in the area of living reef. There was 3%- 30% living reef.

description.narrative: Population of 4 indicator species sustained in PAs proposed to be monitored: 1. Endemic Giant Swallowtail Butterfly (Pterouus humerus) 2. Queen Conch (Strombus gigas) 3. Black Bill Parrot (Amazona agilis) 4.Yellow Bill Parrot (Amazona collaria)

comment.narrative:
Number of individuals of:
endemic Giant Swallowtail Butterfly (Pterouus humerus), endemic Jamaican BlackBird (Nesopsar niggerrimus), Hawksbill Turtle (Eretmochelys imbricate), and Queen Conch (Strombus gigas) (exact figures to be determined at project inception)

Distribution and Density of endemic Swallowtail Butterfly same as baseline data No change in Queen Conch: Depth Strata (metres)
0 -10 – 243 conch/hectare
10-20 - 145 conch/hectare
20-30 – 165 conch/hectare Biomass estimate – 12,214 metric tonne
Current data is unavailable, however a survey is to be done for the biomass of Queen Conch and the report should be available by early 2016.

description.narrative: Strengthening of financial planning and revenue generation
Increase in Protected Area Trust Fund principal and annual disbursement to NPAS

comment.narrative:
Trust Fund Principle: 0
Annual Disbursement to NPAS: 0
Caribbean Biodiversity Fund (CBF) Principal: US$ 3.35 million Disbursement to NPAS: US$ 100,000 - US$ 250,000

CBF Principal: US$ 3.4 million Still awaiting transfer of US$ 750,000 from UNDP to the CBF. Disbursement to NPAS (from CBF): $0. Processes leading to the signing of the Vertical Agreement with the CBF are underway

description.narrative: Amount of funds generated locally by the Local PA Trust Fund. % of the Trust Fund principal generated locally

comment.narrative: $0 Mechanism to capitalize Trust Fund is being developed. Tourism Enhancement Fund (TEF) Proposal being developed. Preliminary discussions have been positive.

description.narrative: Increase in annual government funding for PAs

comment.narrative: No data collected

description.narrative: Increase in annual non-government resources

comment.narrative: No data collected

description.narrative: Number of PAs with business plans that reflect NPAS standards

comment.narrative: 0 PAs with business plans that reflect NPAS standards

8 PAs with business plans that reflect NPAS standards
(25% increase)
Four business plans have been completed, but require revisions based on the recommendations of the Project Steering Committee. The development of four additional business plans is underway.

description.narrative: Local Protected Area Trust Fund 100% established and fully operational by 2016.

comment.narrative: 0 Protected Areas Trust Fund existing locally
Establishment of the Local Trust Fund by 2014. Operationalization of the Local Trust Fund by 2016.

Local Trust Fund was established in December 2014.
The operationalization process is underway. The National Conservation Trust Fund of Jamaica Board established and endorsed by the relevant Government Minister. Draft By-laws have been completed and will be finalized shortly.

description.narrative: Number of Protected Areas with mechanisms to generate revenue at the site level

comment.narrative: 1 PAs with mechanisms to generate revenue (BJCMNP)
Revenue generation in 5 PAs
1 PA with mechanisms to generate revenue (BJCMNP). However, plans are underway to facilitate the development of revenue generation mechanisms in additional PAs.

description.narrative: Extent to which operational plan for the PA system financial strategy developed.

comment.narrative: No such strategy available.
Operational Plan for the PA system financial strategy developed.
The NPAS Project has procured the services of Global Parks volunteers to facilitate the development of the operational plan for the PA system financial strategy. Completion expected by December 2016.

description.narrative: Rationalizing and integrating the NSPA
Status of developing drafting instructions for umbrella PA legislation and supporting legal framework.

comment.narrative: 0 Umbrella legislation for NPAS
Drafting instructions for umbrella PA legislation and supporting legal framework developed
Drafting instructions partially completed (draft should be ready by September 2015). Draft policy near completion (should be ready by mid-August 2015)

description.narrative: Number of new PA landscapes declared and implementing management plans that reflect integrated landscape/seascape wide approaches to combating PA threats

comment.narrative: Zero (0) new coastal and marine PA landscapes declared and implementing management plans that reflect integrated landscape/seascape wide approaches to combating PA threats
One (1) new coastal and one (1) new marine PA landscape declared and implementing management plans that reflect integrated landscape/seascape wide approaches to combating PA threats.
No new PA landscapes declared and implementing management plans.

description.narrative: Number of PAs with clearly designated lead and support entity.

comment.narrative: One (1) PA within NSPA legal agreement designation PA management authority.
6 Protected Areas within the NPAS with legal agreements designating PA Management Authority.
Four (4) agreements are in place for the system.

description.narrative: Increasing PA management effectiveness
Increase in PA management effectiveness measured by METT scores

comment.narrative: METT Scores for 28 PAs and 4 Forest Regions: Montego Bay Marine Park - 44 Blue and John Crow Mtn National Park 72 Negril EPA - 32 Negril Marine Park 39 Palisadoes-Port Royal Protected Area 27 Coral Spring-Mountain Spring 19 Portland Bight Protected Area 36 Ocho Rios Protected Area 19 Mason River protected Area - 54 Bogue Islands Fish Sanctuary - 14 Bowden Fish Sanctuary - 13 Airport Point Fish Sanctuary - 46 Discovery Bay Fish Sanctuary - 34 Bluefields Bay Fish Sanctuary - 33 Orange Bay Fish Sanctuary - 36 Galeon Bay Fish Sanctuary - 30 Salt Harbour Fish Sanctuary - 36 Galleon Harbour Fish Sanctuary - 32 Three Bays Fish Sanctuary - 32 Forestry Northeast - 58 Forestry Southeast - 56 Forestry Northwest - 40 Forestry Southwest - 45 Port Royal and Palisadoes - 52 Black River - 21 Spanish Town - 41 Titchfield Hill - 43 Falmouth - 35 Seville - 74 Rio Nuevo - 17 Mountain River Cave - 44 Mason River Reserve - 54 (Note that there are 102 Forest Reserves found within the four (4) Forest Regions listed as individual PAs)
25% overall increase in METT scores for 50% of the 28 PAs and 4 Forest Regions of NPAS.

METT Scores for 28 PAs and 4 Forest Regions at Mid-Project (2012-2013):
Montego Bay Marine Park - 66 Blue and John Crow Mtn National Park 75 Negril EPA - 36 Negril Marine Park 36 Palisadoes-Port Royal Protected Area 29 Coral Spring-Mountain Spring 19 Portland Bight Protected Area 50 Ocho Rios Protected Area 22 Mason River protected Area - 54 Bogue Islands Special Fishery Conservation Area - 53 Port Morant Special Fishery Conservation Area (formerly Bowden Fish Sanctuary) - 13 Montego Bay Point Special Fishery Conservation Area (formerly Airport Point Fish Sanctuary) - 50 Discovery Bay Special Fishery Conservation Area - 60 Bluefields Bay Special Fishery Conservation Area- 66 Orange Bay Special Fishery Conservation Area - 52 Galleon Bay Special Fishery Conservation Area - 49 Salt Harbour Special Fishery Conservation Area - 62 Galleon Harbour Special Fishery Conservation Area - 63 Three Bays Special Fishery Conservation Area- 61 Forestry Northeast - 62 Forestry Southeast - 58 Forestry Northwest - 43 Forestry Southwest - 49 Port Royal and Palisadoes - 67 Black River - 52 Spanish Town - 60 Titchfield Peninsula - 55 Falmouth Historic District - 57 Seville Great House - 72 Rio Nuevo - 29 Mountain River Cave - 50 Mason River Reserve - 54 (Note that there are 102 Forest Reserves found within the four (4) Forest Regions listed as individual PAs)

description.narrative: Number of PAs that contribute to and/or access biological information through CBD Jamaica Clearing House Mechanism (JaCHM).

comment.narrative: One (1) PA contributing to and accessing the CBD JaCHM.
28 PAs and 4 Forest Regions contributing to the JaCHM. Accessing of database and website by end users to include PA Managers (100% of PAs)

Same as in June 2014. Currently the NPAS Project Management Unit is liaising with the JaCHM to ascertain the process for increasing access and/or contributions to the JaCHM on the part of Protected Areas

description.narrative: Number of PAs with management plans that reflect NPAS management guideline standards

comment.narrative: Zero (0) PAs with management plans that reflect NPAS management guideline standards
8 PAs with management plans that reflect NPAS management guideline standards (25%)
Five (5) PAs with management plans. NPAS guidelines are near completion.

description.narrative: Extent to which the Monitoring and Evaluation (M&E) System for NPA management developed.

comment.narrative: 0 M&E system for NPA Management
Monitoring and Evaluation sytem for protected area management developed.

Research is being conducted by the NPAS Biodiversity Conservation Specialist (University of the West Indies, Mona) towards the devlopment of the Monitoring and Evaluation System for Protected Area Management.

description.narrative: Number of PAS with conservation-based economic activities

comment.narrative: 0 PAs with conservation-based economic activities
3 PAs with conservation-based economic activities implemented.

Proposals have been requested from the following protected areas: Pedro Bank, Black River, Gourie Forest Reserve, Port Royal Heritage District and Mason RIver Protected Area. A proposal was received from the Gourie Forest Reserve.

description.narrative: Status of implementation of Communication Strategy for NPAS

comment.narrative: Communication Strategy for NPAS implemented in 20 key PAs

Communication Strategy for NPAS implemented in 7 key PAs. Plans are being finalized to implement the Communication Strategy for NPAS in PAs through various means including Public Service Announcements.

title.narrative: Deployment of Renewable Energy and Energy Efficiency

description.narrative: This project seeks to advance a low carbon development path and reduce Jamaica’s public sector energy bill through the introduction of renewable energy (RE) and improvement in energy efficiency (EE) in the health sector.

title.narrative: DraftProDoc-Deployment of Renewable Energy and Improvement of Energy Efficiency Project

description.narrative: To build relevant capacity in the public sector by increasing the knowledge base of its operatives on matters pertinent to RE and EE as well as developing the appropriate technical skills necessary to support investments in the sector.
Energy - power generation

title.narrative: Localizing the SDGs: Global Goals, Local Action

description.narrative: The project will support the development of a coordination mechanism for the implementation of the SDGS in Jamaica; foster awareness of the goals ; and improve data quality across MDAs involved in the production of the SDG indicators.

The project will support the development of a coordination mechanism for the implementation of the SDGS in Jamaica; foster awareness of the goals ; and improve data quality across MDAs involved in the production of the SDG indicators
